oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diversity-oriented approach to spirocycles via ring-closing metathesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
ALI, R
CHINNAM, AK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Spirocycles
Carbonyl compounds
Ring-closing metathesis
Propellane derivative
HELICAL PRIMARY STRUCTURES
IMINIUM ION CYCLIZATION
CONCISE TOTAL-SYNTHESIS
DIELS-ALDER REACTION
OLEFIN METATHESIS
KEY STEPS
ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
CROSS-METATHESIS
ACID-DERIVATIVES
SPIRO-ANNULATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have demonstrated a simple and an efficient method for the synthesis of spirocycles starting with inexpensive and commercially available carbonyl compounds. Various spirocycles involving spiropropellane derivative have been assembled via ring-closing metathesis with the aid of Grubbs' first generation catalyst. (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
